questions.text: A Rat is put into a 2-chamber box, a buzzer rang for 5 seconds before the floor of the shock compartment is electrified. If the rat jumps the hurdle between the compartments within the five-second interval between buzzer onset and shock, the buzzer is turned off and shock is avoided. What is the type of learning explained in the about said scenario?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Avoidance learning It is a type of learning where a noxious stimulus is avoided by the response . A warning signal is before the aversive stimulus.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect Options:- Option B: Escape learning is an example of instrumental conditioning based on negative reinforcement. There is no warning signal before the aversive stimulus. Option C: In Classic conditioning/Pavlov's conditioning , a neutral stimulus regularly precedes an unconditioned stimulus that evokes an unconditioned response as a result of this pairing the previously neutral conditioned stimulus now begins to evoke a response. For example, an adolescent who was terrorized by an attack by a group of students near a school then develops an extremely negative physiological reaction each time he or she is near the school. Option D: Operant conditioning occurs when a child learns to avoid traumatic reminders to prevent distressing feelings from arising. For example, if a child was in a motor vehicle accident, the child may then refuse to ride in cars altogether to prevent negative physiological reactions and fear from occurring.

questions.text: A 12-year-old school-going girl is having extreme fear of free-roaming stray dogs, but she is not afraid of seeing pet dogs that are on leashes or restrained at her friend’s home. What is the type of operant learning seen in this condition?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Discrimination Discrimination is the process of learning to make one response to one stimulus and another response or no response to another stimulus.

Random:

Explanation for Incorrect Options:- Option B: Extinction in classical conditioning is the process of presenting the conditioned stimulus alone without the unconditioned stimulus for a number of trials. A classical example of extinction is the no salivating response of the dog when he was not offered treats, during the experiment conducted by Pavlov. Option C: Stimulus generation is the tendency to give conditioned responses to stimuli that are similar in some way to the conditioned stimulus but have never been paired with the unconditioned stimulus. Option D: Escape learning is an example of instrumental conditioning based on negative reinforcement.

questions.text: A toddler previously learn that showing tantrums in the grocery shop can fetch him candies by his mother, but when the mother stop giving attention to those tantrums, the tantrums got reduced every time and it got vanished finally. What is the learning mechanism seen here?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Extinction Extinction in classical conditioning is the process of presenting the conditioned stimulus alone without the unconditioned stimulus for a number of trials. A classical example of extinction is the no salivating response of the dog when he was not offered treats, during the experiment conducted by Pavlov.

Random:

Explanation for Incorrect Options:- Option: B. Escape learning is an example of instrumental conditioning based on negative reinforcement. Option: C. Avoidance learning the learned response is made before the onset of a noxious event and thus prevents the learner from being exposed to the noxious event, thus the noxious event is avoided. Option: D. Discrimination is the process of learning to make one response to one stimulus and another response or no response to another stimulus .
